section.docs: Invitations connect people to meetings. They can be confirmed or rejected. They have a unique hash key that's used to generate a private URL that people outside the system can use to track the meeting.

section.title: Routes & Permissions
section.docs:
* `PUT /invitation/:id/confirm` * `PUT /invitation/:id/reject`
These routes take no paramters. The `:id` refers to the `hash_key`. The system will only show you hash keys for your meetings so you cannot mess with other people's invitations.
**NOTE**: A user api key is not required for these routes since the server assumes only the person who owns the invitation will know the hash key.

state
pending, cancelled, or rescheduled
hash_key
GUID for this invitation. Only given if you own this invitation
meeting
ID for associated meeting
user
The user this invitation belongs to
contact
The contact this invitation belongs to
